comment: The intro video has a teacher who gives a different name than the one listed in the course description and syllabus, leaving me unsure if she is really our professor. On top of that, every lecture video is full of distracting “ums,” “uhs,” and “hmms,” making it hard to follow, and on top of that, you can't even hear her. Find a different professor.

82 in the class. 2 tests, about 7 journals, discussions every week, and a lot of reading. I wouldn't recommend this if you don't like doing journals or discussions. Test aren't easy at all and are on a lockdown browser. Weekly recorded lessons help some but lose my interest really fast (it's hard to understand her). Not a bad prof, not the greatest
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: This course was easy. One 150 discussion every week and a 500 page paper due every 2 weeks. She does provide articles to read.. however all the information you need to know for tests are included in her lecture videos so watch those and take notes. Your attendance grade is based on participation in discussion posts. Clear rubric. Easy A.

Prof. G was awesome. She genuinely cared and appreciated that I reached out for feedback on a couple of assignments, and even bumped a grade for the extra effort. Easy to attain an A in the class; do the weekly discussion post(I made mine and responded to 2), short essay every 2 weeks, midterm and final. Might say do the extra credit

I loved this class! The readings were sometimes hard to understand but her lectures helped better grasp the concept. Professor G. provided extra credits which helped me get an A because I am a horrible test taker. The exams are hard however she does curve. She also does take a few days to  get in touch. As long as you are organized you are good!

This class is straightforward, one lecture and two discussion posts weekly, a journal due every two weeks, a midterm exam and a final. The work was not too hard as long as you follow the guidelines. Make sure you study the lectures for the exams and you should do well. Lastly, make sure you take advantage of the extra credit assignments given.

nice teacher, the course was a little messy but overall good. there is a weekly discussion post that doesn't show on the calendar so watch out for that. grading was not too tough, after the first 2 weeks you can easily get As on every assignment.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: There was one weekly discussion, and a journal that was due every two weeks. The class was very interesting and was not difficult at all. If you keep up with the work you will get an A.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Gumustekin's class is very straightforward and as long as you do every assignment, you'll do just fine. Our midterm was near impossible, but she gave us a very heavy curve which most of my past professors would never. Made an A with a poor midterm grade and no extra credit.

Not a bad class. It is sometimes difficult to follow what she is saying, however if you watch her weekly powerpoint videos, then you are guaranteed to do well on the tests. There are weekly discussions that follow the readings and a journal is due every two weeks.

She's very nice, but hard to understand well at times. There's even information in some presentations that are just false, but I can't tell if that's due to the information she is given or if she said something wrong. Once again, she is nice and will respond to your emails well. I wouldn't take her again, but if you're very patient, you'll be fine!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Caring

comment: The readings were quite heavy and I often skimmed them and did fine. Put work and care into your responses because she does read them. Her lecture videos were a bit hard to hear but she explained them well. Take tons of notes, the concepts are a bit vague sometimes. I liked her and she always responds to emails. I would take her again easily.
She gives crazy good extra credit, I got 12 whole grade points in extra credit alone. She also curves tests pretty heavily. The only hard part was the 500 page journals every two weeks.

This class was online for me. Consisted of weekly modules that included readings, discussions, journals, and videos. The class was fairly easy, however, it was a lot of reading. The discussions were fun and the journals were interesting. The tests were very hard. Would not take this professor again, but very nice.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Online Savvy

comment: Great teacher. She is very organized and she would upload videos explaining everything which was very helpful. She was a fair grader and willing to help.

I really liked her American Government class. She is very helpful and her presentations were clear and good. We had two exams and one presentation. For the exams, she provided a study guide and went over test questions. In addition, she provided so many extra credits, which helped us bunched. I think she is a great professor.

This class is 98% writing. A journal of 250 words it due every other week and they have to be on the documentary she assigns. She takes forever to respond to emails. I wanted to drop this class two weeks after starting but everything else that I could take was full so I just had to suck it up. B+ was a struggle to get.

Really sweet professor, she gave us only two tests and one presentation grade for the whole year, but was very lenient with grades. Attendance wasn't mandatory, but she would give question examples that could show up on the tests, which helped a bunch. She cares about her students, loved her class.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Nice lady but the way class is structured makes it extremely difficult to get an A. Only gives you 3 grade opportunities the entire semester (2 tests & a big presentation) and goes incredibly fast. Horrible communication skills. Lecture mostly consists of the class arguing about politics that have nothing to with anything on the test. Do not take!
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Literally we have 3 grades at all in this class, you have very little room for error. She goes very fast in class and spends a whole class day on student presentations instead of learning. Would not recommend her class and will definitely not be taking her again. She's a very nice person but I do not like her class at all.

Only 3 grades in the entire class, two lectures each week and one day is all student presentations. She gets mad when people dont show up but nobody wants to sit through presentations each week. Extremely bias in politics , if she doesnt agree she will let you know and embarrass you. Wish there was more grades disappointing and easy to fail .

What a great class!!! She challenged my view about many things. She uses many interesting documentaries and videos. Class discussions were also informing and enjoyable. She is a fair grader and always gives many chances and provides extra credit opportunities for students. I would definitely take it again.

Took her Peace and Conflict class this semester. Long class and a lot of information. Only negative thing I have to say is that English isnt her first language so often times her lectures, notes, and assignments were confusing. Otherwise she knows the material well and isnt a bad teacher. Fair grader, will work with you if you dont understand.
rating_tags: SO MANY PAPERS--LECTURE HEAVY--Get ready to read

comment: Took her 3 hour Peace and Conflict class as a freshman. She has a lot of material but works with you in class. You have at least 2 readings every week but you only have to write 4 journals overall on any readings you want. I would take her if you are a hard worker.
